meanings.definition: Capable of being interchanged or swapped
meanings.sent1: The colors of the blocks are permutable, so you can switch them around easily.
meanings.sent2: The permutable nature of the puzzle pieces allows for endless combinations.
meanings.sent3: It was a permutable situation, like trying to fit square pegs into round holes.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like permutable puzzle pieces, constantly shifting and changing.
meanings.sent5: The permutable patterns in the kaleidoscope mesmerized the children.

meanings.definition: Able to be rearranged or reorganized
meanings.sent1: The furniture in the room is permutable, so we can change the layout whenever we want.
meanings.sent2: The permutable schedule allows for flexibility in our plans.
meanings.sent3: His excuses were as permutable as the weather, always changing.
meanings.sent4: The permutable nature of the garden reflected the changing seasons.
meanings.sent5: The permutable words in the poem created a sense of fluidity and movement.
